  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured to off-load audit logs onto a different system or storage media from the system being audited.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204506r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030201
Identities:SV-95729
V-81017
CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

One method of off-loading audit logs in Red Hat Enterprise Linux is with the use of the audisp-remote dameon. Without the configuration of the "au-remote" plugin, the audisp-remote daemon will not off load the logs from the system being audited.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
Fix Text:Edit the /etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf file and add or update the following values:

direction = out
path = /sbin/audisp-remote
type = always

The audit daemon must be restarted for changes to take effect:

# service auditd restart
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:95729
Result:false
Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.
Description:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must configure the au-remote plugin to off-load audit logs using the audisp-remote daemon.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf active = yes)
    • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf direction = out)
    • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf path = /sbin/audisp-remote)
    • false (/etc/audisp/plugins.d/au-remote.conf type = always)

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Result:Fail

SV-86707

Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to off-load audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must encrypt the transfer of audit records off-loaded onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204510r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030310
Identities:V-72085
SV-86709
CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
Description: Information stored in one location is vulnerable to accidental or incidental deletion or alteration.

Off-loading is a common process in information systems with limited audit storage capacity.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000342-GPOS-00133, SRG-OS-000479-GPOS-00224 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to encrypt the transfer of off-loaded audit records onto a different system or media from the system being audited.

Uncomment the "enable_krb5" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it with the following line:

enable_krb5 = yes

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when the audit storage volume is full.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204511r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030320
Identities:V-72087
SV-86711
CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
Description: Taking appropriate action in case of a filled audit storage volume will minimize the possibility of losing audit records.
One method of off-loading audit logs in Red Hat Enterprise Linux is with the use of the audisp-remote dameon. false
Fix Text:Configure the action the operating system takes if the disk the audit records are written to becomes full.

Uncomment or edit the "disk_full_action" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it to "syslog", "single", or "halt", such as the following line:

disk_full_action = single
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that the audit system takes appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204512r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030321
Identities:V-73163
SV-87815
CCI-001851 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4 (1))
Description: Taking appropriate action when there is an error sending audit records to a remote system will minimize the possibility of losing audit records.
One method of off-loading audit logs in Red Hat Enterprise Linux is with the use of the audisp-remote dameon. false
Fix Text:Configure the action the operating system takes if there is an error sending audit records to a remote system.

Uncomment the "network_failure_action" option in "/etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf" and set it to "syslog", "single", or "halt".

network_failure_action = syslog

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must immediately notify the System Administrator (SA) and Information System Security Officer (ISSO) (at a minimum) via email when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204514r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-030340
Identities:V-72091
SV-86715
CCI-001855 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-5 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-5 (1))
Description: If security personnel are not notified immediately when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached, they are unable to expand the audit record storage capacity before records are lost. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to immediately notify the SA and ISSO (at a minimum) when the threshold for the repository maximum audit record storage capacity is reached.

Uncomment or edit the "space_left_action" keyword in "/etc/audit/auditd.conf" and set it to "email".

space_left_action = email
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (/etc/audit/auditd.conf space_left_action = email)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8671500 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:/etc/audit/auditd.conf space_left_action = email
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8671500 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • ignore_case = true
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[ ]*space_left_action[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8671500 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^[Ee][Mm][Aa][Ii][Ll]$'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ false ]
  • filepath equals '/etc/audit/auditd.conf'
  • path equals '/etc/audit'
  • filename equals 'auditd.conf'
  • pattern equals '^[ ]*space_left_action[ ]+=[ ]+([^ ]*)[ ]*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'space_left_action = SYSLOG'
  • line equals 'space_left_action = SYSLOG'
  • subexpression equals 'SYSLOG'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
subexpression

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204516r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030360
Identities:V-72095
SV-86719
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
Description: Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have significant adverse impacts on organizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to audit the execution of privileged functions.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k setuid
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C uid!=euid -F euid=0 -k setuid
-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k setgid
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S execve -C gid!=egid -F egid=0 -k setgid

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:710
Result:error
Title:The Red Hat EnterpriseLinux Operating system must audit all executions of privileged functions.
Description:Misuse of privileged functions, either intentionally or unintentionally by authorized users, or by unauthorized external entities that have compromised information system accounts, is a serious and ongoing concern and can have a significant adverse impacts on orginizations. Auditing the use of privileged functions is one way to detect such misuse and identify the risk from insider threats and the advanced persistent threat.
Class:compliance

  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (All child checks must be true.)
          • error (audit augenrules execve uid 64-bit)
          • error (audit augenrules execve gid 64-bit)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules execve uid 32-bit)
      • error (audit augenrules execve gid 32-bit)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (audit auditctl execve uid 64-bit)
          • false (audit auditctl execve gid 64-bit)

            • false (64 bit architecture)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chown, fchown, fchownat, and lchown syscalls.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204517r809570_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030370
Identities:CCE-27364-9
SV-86721
V-72097
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219 false
Fix Text:Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chown,fchown,fchownat,lchown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chown,fchown,fchownat,lchown -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:552
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-030370 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chown, fchown, fchownat and lchown syscalls.
Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit chown)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit fchown)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit fchownat)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit lchown)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit chown)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit fchown)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit fchownat)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit lchown)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit chown)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fchown)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fchownat)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lchown)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit chown)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit fchown)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit fchownat)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit lchown)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+chown[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])chown([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'

Title:audit auditctl

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chmod, fchmod, and fchmodat syscalls.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204521r809772_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030410
Identities:CCE-27339-1
SV-86729
V-72105
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chmod", "fchmod", and "fchmodat" syscalls.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chmod,fchmod,fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chmod,fchmod,fchmodat -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:546
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-030410 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chmod, fchmod and fchmodat syscalls.
Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit chmod)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit fchmod)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit fchmodat)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit chmod)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit fchmod)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit fchmodat)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit chmod)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fchmod)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fchmodat)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit chmod)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit fchmod)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit fchmodat)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setxattr, fsetxattr, lsetxattr, removexattr, fremovexattr, and lremovexattr syscalls.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204524r809775_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030440
Identities:CCE-27213-8
SV-86735
V-72111
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "setxattr", "fsetxattr", "lsetxattr", "removexattr", "fremovexattr", and "lremovexattr" syscalls.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr,fsetxattr,lsetxattr,removexattr,fremovexattr,lremovexattr -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k perm_mod

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:607
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-030440 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setxattr, fsetxattr, lsetxattr, removexattr, fremovexattr and lremovexattr syscalls.
Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit setxattr)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit lremovexattr)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit lsetxattr)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit removexattr)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit fremovexattr)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit fsetxattr)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)

          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)

            • false (64 bit architecture)

      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit fsetxattr)

    • false (All child checks must be true.)

        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit setxattr)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lremovexattr)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit lsetxattr)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit removexattr)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fremovexattr)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit fsetxattr)

          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)

        • false (audit auditctl)

Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate, and ftruncate syscalls.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204531r809815_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030510
Identities:CCE-80386-6
SV-86749
V-72125
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SRG-OS-000461-GPOS-00205, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "creat", "open", "openat", "open_by_handle_at", "truncate", and "ftruncate" syscalls.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat,open,openat,open_by_handle_at,truncate,ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k access

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:805
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-030510 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the creat, open, openat, open_by_handle_at, truncate and ftruncate syscalls.
Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
Class:compliance

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2621 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+creat[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])creat([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EPERM[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+open[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])open([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+exit=\-EPERM[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000[\s]+)(?:.*-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'

Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the semanage command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204536r833109_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030560
Identities:CCE-80391-6
SV-86759
V-72135
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "semanage" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/semanage -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:618
Result:error
Title:Record Any Attempts to Run semanage
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of semanage is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules semanage)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl semanage)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:619 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules semanage
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2484 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/semanage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*)?x([rwa]*)?[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item/State Result:

  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the setsebool command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204537r833112_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030570
Identities:CCE-80392-4
V-72137
SV-86761
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000463-GPOS-00207, SRG-OS-000465-GPOS-00209 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "setsebool" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/setsebool -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:621
Result:error
Title:Record Any Attempts to Run setsebool
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of setsebool is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules setsebool)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl setsebool)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:622 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules setsebool
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2486 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/setsebool[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)

Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all unsuccessful account access events.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204540r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030610
Identities:CCE-80383-3
V-72145
SV-86769
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when unsuccessful account access events occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /var/run/faillock -p wa -k logins

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:675
Result:error
Title:Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - faillock
Description:Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules faillock)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl faillock)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:677 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2524 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w\s+/var/run/faillock/?\s+\-p\s+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

Title:audit augenrules

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all successful account access events.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204541r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030620
Identities:CCE-80384-1
V-72147
SV-86771
CCI-000126 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-2.1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-2 d; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-2 c)
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000470-GPOS-00214, SRG-OS-000473-GPOS-00218 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful account access events occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /var/log/lastlog -p wa -k logins

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:676
Result:error
Title:Record Attempts to Alter Login and Logout Events - lastlog
Description:Audit rules should be configured to log successful and unsuccessful login and logout events.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules lastlog)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl lastlog)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:679 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules lastlog
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2526 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w\s+/var/log/lastlog\s+\-p\s+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ not evaluated ]
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:680 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl lastlog
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w\s+/var/log/lastlog\s+\-p\s+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b\s+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the passwd command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204542r833121_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030630
Identities:CCE-80395-7
SV-86773
V-72149
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "passwd" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/passwd -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:733
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - passwd
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of passwd is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules passwd)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl passwd)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:734 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules passwd
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2570 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ not evaluated ]
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:735 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl passwd
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2571 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/passwd[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unix_chkpwd command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204543r833124_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030640
Identities:CCE-80396-5
SV-86775
V-72151
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chage command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204545r833130_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030660
Identities:CCE-80398-1
SV-86779
V-72155

Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:715
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - chage
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of chage is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules chage)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl chage)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:716 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules chage
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2558 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ not evaluated ]
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:717 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl chage
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2559 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/chage[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the userhelper command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204546r833133_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030670
Identities:CCE-80399-9
SV-86781
V-72157
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged password commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "userhelper" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/userhelper -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-passwd

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:763
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - userhelper
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of userhelper is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules userhelper)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl userhelper)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/sbin\/userhelper[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the su command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204547r833136_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030680
Identities:CCE-80400-5
SV-86783
V-72159
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "su" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/su -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Weight:10.0

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudo command.

Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030690
Identities:CCE-80401-3
V-72161
SV-86785

CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the sudoers file and all files in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204549r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030700
Identities:CCE-27461-3
V-72163
SV-86787
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to access the "/etc/sudoers" file and files in the "/etc/sudoers.d/" directory.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k privileged-actions

-w /etc/sudoers.d/ -p wa -k privileged-actions

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:773
Result:error
Title:Audit System Administrator Actions
Description:Audit actions taken by system administrators on the system.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules sudoers)
      • error (audit augenrules sudoers.d)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl sudoers)
      • false (audit auditctl sudoers.d)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:774 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules sudoers
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2598 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/sudoers[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8678700 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules sudoers.d
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8678700 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/sudoers\.d/?[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)

Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the newgrp command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204550r833142_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030710
Identities:CCE-80403-9
V-72165
SV-86789
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "newgrp" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/newgrp -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:727
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - newgrp
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of newgrp is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules newgrp)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl newgrp)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:728 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules newgrp
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2566 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/newgrp[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ not evaluated ]
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:729 (textfilecontent54_test)

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/newgrp[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the chsh command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204551r833145_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030720
Identities:CCE-80404-7
SV-86791
V-72167
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged access commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000037-GPOS-00015, SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "chsh" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/chsh -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-priv_change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
