The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204552r833148_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030740
Identities:CCE-27447-2
V-72171
SV-86795
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "mount" command and syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount
-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/mount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:686
Result:error
Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the mount command and syscall.
Description:Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is no possible if audit records do not contain enough information. At a minimum, the orginization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The orginization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules /bin/mount)
        • error (audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules mount 64-bit)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules mount 32-bit)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl /bin/mount)
        • false (audit auditctl /usr/bin/mount)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl mount 64-bit)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl mount 32-bit)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68600 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules /bin/mount
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:68600 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(?:(\-F[\s]+path=\/bin\/mount[\s]+))(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?(?:-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:68601 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules /usr/bin/mount
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(?:(-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/mount[\s]+))(-F\s+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)\s+)?(?:-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:688 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules mount 64-bit
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(\-F\s+arch=b64\s+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+mount[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])mount([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'

  • node_name equals ''
  • os_name equals ''
  • os_release equals ''
  • os_version equals ''
  • processor_type equals ''
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
processor_type
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:687 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules mount 32-bit
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2532 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-a\s+always,exit\s+(\-F\s+arch=b32\s+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+mount[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])mount([\s]+|[,])))(?:.*-F\s+auid>=1000\s+\-F\s+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)\s+)(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+\s*$'

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the umount command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204553r833151_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030750
Identities:CCE-80405-4
V-72173
SV-86797
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged mount commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "umount" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/umount -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-mount

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:757
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - umount
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of umount is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules umount)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl umount)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:758 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2586 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)

Title:audit augenrules

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:759 (textfilecontent54_test)

Title:audit auditctl umount
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=(\/usr)?\/bin\/umount[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the postdrop command.

Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030760
Identities:CCE-80406-2
V-72175
SV-86799
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged postfix commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the ssh-keysign command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204556r833160_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030780
Identities:CCE-80408-8
SV-86803
V-72179
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged ssh commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "ssh-keysign" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/libexec/openssh/ssh-keysign -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-ssh

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:745
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - ssh_keysign
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of ssh_keysign is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules ssh_keysign)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl ssh_keysign)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2578 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/libexec\/openssh\/ssh-keysign[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the crontab command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204557r833163_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030800
Identities:CCE-80410-4
SV-86807
V-72183
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: Reconstruction of harmful events or forensic analysis is not possible if audit records do not contain enough information.

At a minimum, the organization must audit the full-text recording of privileged commands. The organization must maintain audit trails in sufficient detail to reconstruct events to determine the cause and impact of compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000042-GPOS-00020, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "crontab" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/bin/crontab -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-cron

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:721
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - crontab
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of crontab is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules crontab)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl crontab)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:

  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+-F[\s]+path=\/usr\/bin\/crontab[\s]+(-F[\s]+perm=([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid>=1000[\s]+-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the pam_timestamp_check command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204558r833166_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030810
Identities:CCE-80411-2
V-72185
SV-86809
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "pam_timestamp_check" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F path=/usr/sbin/pam_timestamp_check -F perm=x -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k privileged-pam

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the create_module syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204559r833169_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030819
Identities:V-78999
SV-93705
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "create_module" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S create_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S create_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:93705
Result:error
Title:Audit Kernel Module Creation - create_module
Description:The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module creation.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit create_module)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit create_module)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit create_module)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit create_module)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the init_module and finit_module syscalls.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204560r833172_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030820
Identities:CCE-80414-6
V-72187
SV-86811
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "init_module" and "finit_module" syscalls.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S init_module,finit_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k modulechange

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S init_module,finit_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k modulechange

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:657
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-030820 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the init_module and finit_module syscalls.
Description:Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one. Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit init_module)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit finit_module)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit init_module)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit finit_module)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit init_module)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit finit_module)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit init_module)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit finit_module)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-a[\s]+always,exit[\s]+(?:.*-F[\s]+arch=b64[\s]+)(?:.*(-S[\s]+init_module[\s]+|([\s]+|[,])init_module([\s]+|[,]))).*(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[-\w]+[\s]*$'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the delete_module syscall.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204562r833175_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030830
Identities:CCE-80415-3
V-72189
SV-86813
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "delete_module" syscall occur.

Add or update the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S delete_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S delete_module -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k module-change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899

Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:658
Result:error
Title:Audit Kernel Module Loading and Unloading - delete_module
Description:The audit rules should be configured to log information about kernel module loading and unloading.
Class:compliance

            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)

        • true (audit augenrules)

          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)

            • false (64 bit architecture)

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the kmod command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204563r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030840
Identities:SV-86815
V-72191
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00216, SRG-OS-000477-GPOS-00222 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records when successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "kmod" command occur.

Add or update the following rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /usr/bin/kmod -p x -F auid!=unset -k module-change

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:86815
Result:error
Title:Ensure auditd Collects Information on the Use of Privileged Commands - kmod
Description:Audit rules about the information on the use of kmod is enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules kmod)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit auditctl kmod)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8681500 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:audit augenrules kmod
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8681500 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/audit/rules.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '.*\.rules$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*-w\s+\/usr\/bin\/kmod[\s]+((-F[\s]+perm=|-p\s+)([rwa]*x[rwa]*)[\s]+)?-F[\s]+auid!=(?:4294967295|-1|unset)[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)[\S]+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:545 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:audit augenrules
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2427 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ not evaluated ]
  • filepath equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • path equals '/usr/lib/systemd/system'
  • filename equals 'auditd.service'
  • pattern equals '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/augenrules.*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • line equals 'ExecStartPost=-/sbin/augenrules --load'
  • subexpression does not exist
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8681501 (textfilecontent54_test)

Title:audit auditctl kmod
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8681501 (textfilecontent54_object)

  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)

Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/passwd.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204564r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030870
Identities:CCE-80435-1
SV-86821
V-72197
CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect "/etc/passwd".

Add or update the following rule "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:

Result:error

Description:Audit user/group modification.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules /etc/passwd)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (audit /etc/passwd)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/audit/audit.rules'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\-w[\s]+/etc/shadow[\s]+\-p[\s]+\b([rx]*w[rx]*a[rx]*|[rx]*a[rx]*w[rx]*)\b[\s]+(-k[\s]+|-F[\s]+key=)\w+[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:543 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:audit auditctl
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2426 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/usr/lib/systemd/system/auditd.service'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^ExecStartPost=\-\/sbin\/auditctl.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204568r744115_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030874
Identities:CCE-80430-2
SV-87825
V-73173
CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
Description: Without generating audit records that are specific to the security and mission needs of the organization, it would be difficult to establish, correlate, and investigate the events relating to an incident or identify those responsible for one.

Audit records can be generated from various components within the information system (e.g., module or policy filter). false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records for all account creations, modifications, disabling, and termination events that affect /etc/security/opasswd.

Add or update the following file system rule in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-w /etc/security/opasswd -p wa -k identity

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect:
# systemctl restart auditd
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899

Result:error
Title:Audit User/Group Modification (opasswd)
Description:Audit user/group modification (opasswd).
Class:compliance

    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (audit augenrules /etc/security/opasswd)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)

      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unlink, unlinkat, rename, renameat, and rmdir syscalls.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204572r809825_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-030910
Identities:CCE-27206-2
V-72205
SV-86829
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
CCI-002884 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (1) (a))
Description: If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise.

When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way.

The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall made by all programs on the system. Therefore, it is very important to use syscall rules only when absolutely necessary since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. The performance can be helped, however, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210, SRG-OS-000467-GPOS-00211, SRG-OS-000468-GPOS-00212, SRG-OS-000392-GPOS-00172 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to generate audit records upon successful/unsuccessful attempts to use the "unlink", "unlinkat", "rename", "renameat", and "rmdir" syscalls.

Add the following rules in "/etc/audit/rules.d/audit.rules":

-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S unlink,unlinkat,rename,renameat,rmdir -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k delete

-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlink,unlinkat,rename,renameat,rmdir -F auid>=1000 -F auid!=unset -k delete

The audit daemon must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:626
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-030910 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must audit all uses of the unlink, unlinkat, rename, renameat and rmdir syscalls.
Description:If the system is not configured to audit certain activities and write them to an audit log, it is more difficult to detect and track system compromises and damages incurred during a system compromise. When a user logs on, the auid is set to the uid of the account that is being authenticated. Daemons are not user sessions and have the loginuid set to -1. The auid representation is an unsigned 32-bit integer, which equals 4294967295. The audit system interprets -1, 4294967295, and "unset" in the same way. The system call rules are loaded into a matching engine that intercepts each syscall that all programs on the system makes. Therefore, it is very important to only use syscall rules when you have to since these affect performance. The more rules, the bigger the performance hit. You can help the performance, though, by combining syscalls into one rule whenever possible.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit unlink)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit rmdir)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit unlinkat)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit rename)
        • error (audit augenrules 64-bit renameat)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit unlink)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit rmdir)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit unlinkat)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit rename)
      • error (audit augenrules 32-bit renameat)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (audit augenrules)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit unlink)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit rmdir)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit unlinkat)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit rename)
        • false (audit auditctl 64-bit renameat)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
          • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
            • false (64 bit architecture)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit unlink)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit rmdir)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit unlinkat)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit rename)
      • false (audit auditctl 32-bit renameat)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (audit auditctl)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must limit the number of concurrent sessions to 10 for all accounts and/or account types.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204576r603261_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-040000
Identities:CCE-27081-9
V-72217
SV-86841
CCI-000054 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-10)
Description: Operating system management includes the ability to control the number of users and user sessions that utilize an operating system. Limiting the number of allowed users and sessions per user is helpful in reducing the risks related to DoS attacks.

This requirement addresses concurrent sessions for information system accounts and does not address concurrent sessions by single users via multiple system accounts. The maximum number of concurrent sessions should be defined based on mission needs and the operational environment for each system. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to limit the number of concurrent sessions to "10" for all accounts and/or account types.

Add the following line to the top of the /etc/security/limits.conf or in a ".conf" file defined in /etc/security/limits.d/ :

* hard maxlogins 10
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:449
Result:error
Title:Set Maximum Number of Concurrent Login Sessions Per User
Description:The maximum number of concurrent login sessions per user should meet minimum requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (the value maxlogins should be set appropriately in /etc/security/limits.d/*.conf) (negated)
        • false (the value maxlogins should be set appropriately in /etc/security/limits.conf)
      • error (the value maxlogins should be set appropriately in /etc/security/limits.d/*.conf)
    • error (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (limits.d maxlogins in all domains configured correctly)
      • true (limits.conf maxlogins in all domains configured correctly)
    • error (all values are integers)
Tests:

Check:Result is based on check existence only.

  • path must be equal to '/etc/security/limits.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\*[\s]+(?:(?:hard)|(?:-))[\s]+maxlogins'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with a communication session are terminated at the end of the session or after 15 minutes of inactivity from the user at a command prompt, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204579r646844_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-040160
Identities:SV-86847
V-72223
CCI-001133 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-10.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-10; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-10)
CCI-002361 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-12; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-12)
Description: Terminating an idle session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element.

Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000029-GPOS-00010, SRG-OS-000163-GPOS-00072 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to terminate all network connections associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after a period of inactivity.

Create a script to enforce the inactivity timeout (for example /etc/profile.d/tmout.sh) such as:

#!/bin/bash

declare -xr TMOUT=900
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:510
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-040160 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all network connections associated with a communication session are terminated at the end of the session or after 15 minutes of inactivity from the user at a command prompt, except to fulfill documented and validated mission requirements.
Description:Terminating an idle session within a short time period reduces the window of opportunity for unauthorized personnel to take control of a management session enabled on the console or console port that has been left unattended. In addition, quickly terminating an idle session will also free up resources committed by the managed network element. Terminating network connections associated with communications sessions includes, for example, de-allocating associated TCP/IP address/port pairs at the operating system level and de-allocating networking assignments at the application level if multiple application sessions are using a single operating system-level network connection. This does not mean that the operating system terminates all sessions or network access; it only ends the inactive session and releases the resources associated with that session.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (TMOUT in /etc/profile.d/*.sh)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:512 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:TMOUT in /etc/profile.d/*.sh
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2401 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/profile.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.sh$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*declare[\s]+-xr[\s]+TMOUT[\s]*=[\s]*([\d]*)[\s]*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2400 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be less than or equal to '900'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204584r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040201
Identities:SV-92521
V-77825
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Address space layout randomization (ASLR) makes it more difficult for an attacker to predict the location of attack code he or she has introduced into a process's address space during an attempt at exploitation. Additionally, ASLR also makes it more difficult for an attacker to know the location of existing code in order to repurpose it using return-oriented programming (ROP) techniques. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system implement virtual address space randomization.

Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a config file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

kernel.randomize_va_space = 2

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:92521
Result:false
Title:RHEL-07-040201 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement virtual address space randomization.
Description:Address space layout randomization (ASLR) makes it more difficult for an attacker to predict the location of attack code he or she has introduced into a process's address space during an attempt at exploitation. Additionally, ASLR also makes it more difficult for an attacker to know the location of existing code in order to repurpose it using return-oriented programming (ROP) techniques.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2)
      • error (Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2)
    • true (Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2)
    • error (Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2)
    • false (Check if /sbin/sysctl kernel.randomize_va_space = 2)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252100 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252100 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252100 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '2'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252101 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to 2
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252101 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • behavior requirements:
    • recurse_direction = down
  • path must be equal to '/etc/sysctl.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.+\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252100 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be equal to '2'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252102 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:true
Title:Check /etc/sysctl.conf has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252102 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
Exclude Items If:
  • subexpression equals '2'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252103 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:Check if any .conf file in /etc/sysctl.d has kernel.randomize_va_space set to a value other than 2
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:9252103 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
Exclude Items If:
  • subexpression equals '2'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:9252104 (sysctl_test)
Result:false
Title:Check if /sbin/sysctl kernel.randomize_va_space = 2
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'kernel.randomize_va_space'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:9252101 (sysctl_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must be configured so that all networked systems have SSH installed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204585r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040300
Identities:CCE-80215-7
SV-86857
V-72233
CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8)
CCI-002420 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (2))
CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (1))
CCI-002422 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (2))
Description: Without protection of the transmitted information, confidentiality and integrity may be compromised because unprotected communications can be intercepted and either read or altered.

This requirement applies to both internal and external networks and all types of information system components from which information can be transmitted (e.g., servers, mobile devices, notebook computers, printers, copiers, scanners, and facsimile machines). Communication paths outside the physical protection of a controlled boundary are exposed to the possibility of interception and modification.

Protecting the confidentiality and integrity of organizational information can be accomplished by physical means (e.g., employing physical distribution systems) or by logical means (e.g., employing cryptographic techniques). If physical means of protection are employed, logical means (cryptography) do not have to be employed, and vice versa.

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000423-GPOS-00187, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188, SRG-OS-000425-GPOS-00189, SRG-OS-000426-GPOS-00190 false
Fix Text:Install SSH packages onto the host with the following commands:

# yum install openssh-server.x86_64
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:4248
Result:false
Title:Package openssh-server Installed
Description:The RPM package openssh-server should be installed.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (package openssh-server is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:4249 (rpminfo_test)
Result:false
Title:package openssh-server is installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:4288 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'openssh-server'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204605r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040530
Identities:SV-86899
V-72275
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Providing users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use. false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to provide users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred by setting the required configuration options in "/etc/pam.d/postlogin".

Add the following line to the top of "/etc/pam.d/postlogin":

session required pam_lastlog.so showfailed
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1020
Result:false
Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must display the date and time of the last successful account logon upon logon.
Description:Providing users with feedback on when account accesses last occurred facilitates user recognition and reporting of unauthorized account use.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the silent option)
    • false (Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the showfailed option)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1021 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Check the pam_lastlog configuration of /etc/pam.d/postlogin for the silent option
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:No collected item may match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2791 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename must be equal to 'postlogin'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8689900 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^silent[\s]|[\s]silent[\s]|[\s]silent$|^silent$'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ false ]
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/postlogin'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'postlogin'
  • pattern equals '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
  • instance equals '1'
  • text equals 'session [default=1] pam_lastlog.so nowtmp showfailed'
  • line equals 'session [default=1] pam_lastlog.so nowtmp showfailed'
  • subexpression equals 'nowtmp showfailed'
Collected Item/State Result:
[ true ]
  • filepath equals '/etc/pam.d/postlogin'
  • path equals '/etc/pam.d'
  • filename equals 'postlogin'
  • pattern equals '^[\s]*[^\s#]+[ \t]+[\[\]\w=]+[ \t]+pam_lastlog\.so[ \t]+([\S \t]+)\s*$'
  • instance equals '2'
  • text equals 'session optional pam_lastlog.so silent noupdate showfailed '
  • line equals 'session optional pam_lastlog.so silent noupdate showfailed '
  • subexpression equals 'silent noupdate showfailed'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
subexpression
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8689900 (textfilecontent54_test)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204609r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040610
Identities:CCE-27434-0
V-72283
SV-86907
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl -system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:251
Result:false
Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration)
      • error (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • false (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • error (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) source-routed packets by default.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204612r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040620
Identities:CCE-80162-1
V-72285
SV-86909
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv4 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route = 0

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not respond to Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) echoes sent to a broadcast address.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204613r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040630
Identities:CCE-80165-4
V-72287
SV-86911
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Responding to broadcast (ICMP) echoes facilitates network mapping and provides a vector for amplification attacks. false
Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:284
Result:false
Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
Description:The "net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration)
      • error (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • false (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • error (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to the appropriate value)

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • path must be equal to '/usr/lib/sysctl.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*net\.ipv4\.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts[\s]*=[\s]*(\d+)\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2280 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', subexpression, the following must be true:
    • subexpression must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:332 (sysctl_test)
Result:false
Title:kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts set to the appropriate value
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:2191 (sysctl_object)

  • name must be equal to 'net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:2192 (sysctl_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must prevent Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages from being accepted.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204614r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040640
Identities:CCE-80163-9
SV-86913
V-72289
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false
Fix Text:Set the system to not accept IPv4 ICMP redirect messages by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects = 0

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:266
Result:false
Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
Description:The "net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration)
      • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /run/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects static configuration in /usr/lib/sysctl.d/*.conf)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects set to the appropriate value)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must ignore Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirect messages.

Identities:CCE-80158-9

Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages modify the host's route table and are unauthenticated. An illicit ICMP redirect message could result in a man-in-the-middle attack. false

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not allow interfaces to perform Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects by default.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204616r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040650
Identities:CCE-80156-3
V-72291
SV-86915
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: ICMP redirect messages are used by routers to inform hosts that a more direct route exists for a particular destination. These messages contain information from the system's route table, possibly revealing portions of the network topology. false
Fix Text:Configure the system to not allow interfaces to perform IPv4 ICMP redirects by default.

Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects = 0

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration)
      • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • false (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • error (net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects set to 0)

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not send Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects.

Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not be performing packet forwarding unless the system is a router.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204625r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040740
Identities:CCE-80157-1
SV-86933
V-72309
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Routing protocol daemons are typically used on routers to exchange network topology information with other routers. If this software is used when not required, system network information may be unnecessarily transmitted across the network. false
Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv4.ip_forward = 0

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:290
Result:false
Title:Kernel "net.ipv4.ip_forward" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
Description:The "net.ipv4.ip_forward" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration)
      • error (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • false (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • error (net.ipv4.ip_forward static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv4.ip_forward set to 0)

  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*net\.ipv4\.ip_forward[\s]*=[\s]*0[\s]*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must not forward IPv6 source-routed packets.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204630r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-040830
Identities:CCE-80179-5
V-72319
SV-86943
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
Description: Source-routed packets allow the source of the packet to suggest that routers forward the packet along a different path than configured on the router, which can be used to bypass network security measures. This requirement applies only to the forwarding of source-routed traffic, such as when IPv6 forwarding is enabled and the system is functioning as a router. false
Fix Text:Set the system to the required kernel parameter, if IPv6 is enabled, by adding the following line to "/etc/sysctl.conf" or a configuration file in the /etc/sysctl.d/ directory (or modify the line to have the required value):

net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0

Issue the following command to make the changes take effect:

# sysctl --system
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:303
Result:false
Title:Kernel "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" Parameter Configuration and Runtime Check
Description:The "net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route" kernel parameter should be set to the appropriate value in both system configuration and system runtime.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration)
        • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route set to the appropriate value)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • error (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration)
          • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • false (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
          • error (net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 static configuration in /etc/sysctl.d/*.conf)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false (kernel runtime parameter net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 set to 1)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (ipv6.disable=1 in /proc/cmdline)
        • false (ipv6.disable=1 in grub.cfg)
