The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204631r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-041001
Identities:SV-87041
V-72417
CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication by installing the required packages.

Install the pam_pkcs11 package with the following command:

# yum install pam_pkcs11
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87041
Result:false
Title:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
Description:The operating system must have the required packages for multifactor authentication installed.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8704101 (rpminfo_test)
Result:false
Title:package 'pam_pkcs11' is installed
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8704101 (rpminfo_object)
Object Requirements:
  • name must be equal to 'pam_pkcs11'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement multifactor authentication for access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204632r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-041002
Identities:CCE-80437-7
V-72427
SV-87051
CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to implement multifactor authentication for remote access to privileged accounts via pluggable authentication modules (PAM).

Modify all of the services lines in "/etc/sssd/sssd.conf" or in configuration files found under "/etc/sssd/conf.d" to include pam.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:1405
Result:false
Title:Configure PAM in SSSD Services
Description:SSSD should be configured to run SSSD PAM services.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section)
    • false (check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:1406 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of the sssd section
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:3081 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sssd/sssd.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:140601 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:check if pam is configured in the services setting of a conf file in the sssd conf.d directory
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:140601 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must be equal to '/etc/sssd/conf.d'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*\.conf$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*\[sssd\]([^\n]*\n+)+?[\s]*services.*pam.*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-204633r603261_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-041003
Identities:V-72433
SV-87057
CCI-001948 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (11))
CCI-001953 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
CCI-001954 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2 (12); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2 (12))
Description: Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device.

Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card.

A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user.

Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless.

This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).

Satisfies: SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00160, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00161, SRG-OS-000375-GPOS-00162 false
Fix Text:Configure the operating system to do certificate status checking for PKI authentication.

Modify all of the "cert_policy" lines in "/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf" to include "ocsp_on".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:87057
Result:false
Title:The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must implement certificate status checking for PKI authentication.
Description:Using an authentication device, such as a CAC or token that is separate from the information system, ensures that even if the information system is compromised, that compromise will not affect credentials stored on the authentication device. Multifactor solutions that require devices separate from information systems gaining access include, for example, hardware tokens providing time-based or challenge-response authenticators and smart cards such as the U.S. Government Personal Identity Verification card and the DoD Common Access Card. A privileged account is defined as an information system account with authorizations of a privileged user. Remote access is access to DoD nonpublic information systems by an authorized user (or an information system) communicating through an external, non-organization-controlled network. Remote access methods include, for example, dial-up, broadband, and wireless. This requirement only applies to components where this is specific to the function of the device or has the concept of an organizational user (e.g., VPN, proxy capability). This does not apply to authentication for the purpose of configuring the device itself (management).
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
    • false (Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8705700 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Check all cert_policy entries are set with the ocsp_on option in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8705700 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]+);\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:8705700 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must match the pattern '^["']*ocsp_on["']*$|^["']*ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["',\s]|["',\s]ocsp_on["']*$'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:8705701 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Check cert_policy is set with the ocsp_on option 3 or more times in /etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:8705701 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/pam_pkcs11/pam_pkcs11.conf'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^[\s]*cert_policy[ \t]+=[ \t]+([\w\,"' ]*ocsp_on[\w\,"' ]*);\s*$'
  • instance must be greater than or equal to '3'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo".

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-237634r833177_rule
Result:Fail
Version:RHEL-07-010342
Identities:CCI-002227 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (5); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (5))
Description: The sudoers security policy requires that users authenticate themselves before they can use sudo. When sudoers requires authentication, it validates the invoking user's credentials. If the rootpw, targetpw, or runaspw flags are defined and not disabled, by default the operating system will prompt the invoking user for the "root" user password.
For more information on each of the listed configurations, reference the sudoers(5) manual page. false
Fix Text:Define the following in the Defaults section of the /etc/sudoers file or a configuration file in the /etc/sudoers.d/ directory:
Defaults !targetpw
Defaults !rootpw
Defaults !runaspw
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:178
Result:false
Title:RHEL-07-010342 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must use the invoking user's password for privilege escalation when using "sudo".
Description:The sudoers security policy requires that users authenticate themselves before they can use sudo. When sudoers requires authentication, it validates the invoking user's credentials. If the rootpw, targetpw, or runaspw flags are defined and not disabled, by default the operating system will prompt the invoking user for the "root" user password. For more information on each of the listed configurations, reference the sudoers(5) manual page.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
      • false (Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
      • false (Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers)
      • false (Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17800 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17800 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!targetpw\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17801 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Defaults !targetpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17801 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must match the pattern '^/etc/sudoers\.d.*'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!targetpw\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17802 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17802 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!rootpw\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17803 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Defaults !rootpw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17803 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must match the pattern '^/etc/sudoers\.d.*'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!rootpw\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17804 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17804 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • filepath must be equal to '/etc/sudoers'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!runaspw\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17805 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:false
Title:Defaults !runaspw is configured in /etc/sudoers.d
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17805 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • path must match the pattern '^/etc/sudoers\.d.*'
  • filename must match the pattern '^.*$'
  • pattern must match the pattern '^\s*(?i)Defaults\s+\!runaspw\s*$'
  • instance must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must require re-authentication when using the "sudo" command.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-237635r833179_rule
Result:Error
Version:RHEL-07-010343
Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
Description: Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization.

When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the organization requires the user to re-authenticate when using the "sudo" command.

If the value is set to an integer less than 0, the user's time stamp will not expire and the user will not have to re-authenticate for privileged actions until the user's session is terminated. false
Fix Text:Configure the "sudo" command to require re-authentication.
Edit the /etc/sudoers file:
$ sudo visudo

Add or modify the following line:
Defaults timestamp_timeout=[value]
Note: The "[value]" must be a number that is greater than or equal to "0".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
Identifier:2899
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:def:179
Result:error
Title:RHEL-07-010343 - The Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating system must require re-authentication when using the "sudo" command.
Description:Without re-authentication, users may access resources or perform tasks for which they do not have authorization. When operating systems provide the capability to escalate a functional capability, it is critical the organization requires the user to re-authenticate when using the "sudo" command. If the value is set to an integer less than 0, the user's time stamp will not expire and the user will not have to re-authenticate for privileged actions until the user's session is terminated.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • error (All child checks must be true.)
    • error (Defaults timestamp_timeout is configured in /etc/sudoers or /etc/sudoers.d/)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:tst:17900 (textfilecontent54_test)
Result:error
Title:Defaults timestamp_timeout is configured in /etc/sudoers or /etc/sudoers.d/
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:obj:17902 (textfilecontent54_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.rhel7:ste:17900 (textfilecontent54_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', subexpression must be greater than or equal to '0'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
SCAP Compliance Checker - 5.6 - NIWC Atlantic
